meanings.definition: To transplant tissue or organs from one individual to another of the same species.
meanings.sent1: The doctors allografted a kidney from the donor to the recipient.
meanings.sent2: She allografted a heart to save her sister's life.
meanings.sent3: The surgeon allografted a potato into the garden, hoping for a vegetable transplant.
meanings.sent4: The farmer allografted the best traits from different plants to create a super crop.
meanings.sent5: The scientist allografted cells under the microscope, observing the process closely.

meanings.definition: The tissue or organs that have been transplanted from one individual to another of the same species.
meanings.sent1: The allografted heart beat strongly in the patient's chest.
meanings.sent2: The allografted skin helped the burn victim heal faster.
meanings.sent3: The allografted liver was a lifesaver for the patient, who now had a new lease on life.
meanings.sent4: The allografted tissue integrated seamlessly into the recipient's body, functioning perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The allografted organ brought hope and health to the recipient, transforming their quality of life.
